page.title: 18ROSTHERNE NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The late Lord Egerton of Tatton Hall provided for the establishment of a nature reserve at Rostherne.Some of the largest flocks of North European duck which winter in Britain come to Rostherne Mere.Up to 4,000 mallard and over 2,500 teal have been recorded.Other birds include: wigeon, pintail, shoveler, pochard and tufted duck.In winter up to 20,000 gulls gather at dusk.In late summer the mere is visited by flocks of Canada geese.Alltogether 180 different species have been seen.The wardens patrol the reserve to prevent trespass and to carry out management work .They take samples of water to check for water pollution which could disturb the ecology of the mere .
